DOC.brief_title: A Follow-net Investigation Randomised Study Cystoscopy Urethral Dilatation Versus Cystoscopy Alone Women With Overactive Bladder Syndrome Impaired Voiding
DOC.detailed_description: Urinary incontinence highly prevalent distress condition significant impact health relate quality life million woman worldwide . Of woman incontinence , 90 % overactive bladder symptom ( OAB ) , 50 % detrusor overactivity ( DO ) cystometry . The overactive bladder syndrome define International Continence society `` Urinary urgency , without urge incontinence , usually frequency nocturia infection proven pathology '' ( Abrams et al 2002 ) Initial management OAB DO consist conservative measure alter fluid intake , bladder retrain drug therapy . The next step consist intervention cystoscopy urethral dilatation , basis allow intrinsic bladder problem interstitial cystitis exclude , exclude , may confer symptomatic benefit . Cystoscopy urethral dilatation long advocate empirical treatment woman low urinary tract symptom ( LUTS ) . A review literature reveals mark lack evidence regard survey practice amongst UK urologists find 61 % performed urethral dilatation 7 time year survey conduct , although 55 % believe less half patient experience long term improvement ( Masarani Willis , 2006 ) The original study show benefit urethral dilatation versus dilatation 6 month follow ( Duckett 2007 ) . The investigator know natural history patient void dysfunction . Therefore review symptom give good idea happen patient symptoms time . The aim study identify long term benefit urethral dilatation cystoscopy alone .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Significant Overactive Bladder Symptoms Based score 1 2 Urgency Perception Scale On symptom domain KHQ More 8 void per day frequency volume chart +/ 2 episode nocturia 2 . Pressure flow study demonstrate maximum flow rate le 15ml minimum void volume 200ml high normal detrusor pressure maximum flow postvoid residual 200ml 3 . Patients must able give informed consent study . 1 . Presence concurrent urodynamic stress incontinence . 2 . Patients bladder pathology haematuria unknown origin . 3 . Patients neurological disorder ( may affect void ) . 4 . Symptomatic pelvic organ prolapse require intervention 5 .
